result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua R Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Consecutive to the sentences in La Crosse Co cases 13CF411 and 14CF167
.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment (unless already done in prison) and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with any known drug users or dealers
.

Complete any other conditions deemed necessary by the PO

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

No sentence credit if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
To be served on Electronic Monitoring with Justice Support Services

Unpaid Court costs/fees to be converted to a Civil Judgment
.

DOC Balance Inquiry for Civil Judgment

State by Gruenke /  Def in custody w/ Atty Krueger
PROBATION REVOCATION
CRT'S SENTENCE:  9 mos CJ to be served on EM w/ JSS - credit for 83 days;  Unpaid CRT financial obligations are converted to a Civil Judgment
from PO Heidi Helm   re: Sentencing after Revocation / Rev Summary filed
signed TWB
Rachel Krueger
of Plea & SEH on 11/4/14 - Tina B
PO is Direct Assign - BRF

- Motion for Consolidation w/ cases 13CF411, 14CF107 & 14CF537 - Order consolidating cases signed by TWB
- Ineligible Voting Notice filed
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed

3 pm Def in court w/ Atty Patricia L. O'Neil.  Def in custody.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Statement as to Negotiated Plea filed - signed/understands.  Amended Information filed.
14CF-537:  Possession of Meth (Fel)  961.41(3g)(g) and 939.50 (3)(i)    GUILTY
Plea Questionnaire filed - signed/understands.  Rights/elements/questions gone over.  No firearms or voting advised.  Possible deportation advised.  Victim rights act has been complied with.  Mr. Harris states what happened that day.
COURT finds the plea is F, V & I made.  Sufficient factual basis.  Found guilty and convicted.
Skemp comments.  Agrees with Ms. Miles' recommendation on revocaton in 13CF-411 and 14CF-167.  Prison is appropriate.  He's in need of restrictive custodial treatment.  It's not ideal but it's the best we can offer.  Leaves the sentence in 14CF-537 up to the Court.  O'Neil comments.  He was expelled from the Jackson Co. Drug Court.  Asks for em.  Harris states he needs treatment.  COURT comments.
SENTENCES:
13CF-411 - count 1
Total:  2 years, 6 mos
Initial:  1 year, 6 mos w/203 days credit
Ext. Sup.:  1 year
Count 2 - 9 mos CJ - concurrent to count 1
14CF-167
Total:  2 years, 6 mos 
Initial:  1 year, 6 mos - concurrent to 13CF-411 w/203 days credit
Ext. Sup.:  1 year
He is eligible for the ERP and CIP
Copies given to Mr. Harris.
14CF-537
Sentence withheld
1 year probation - consecutive to 13CF-411 and 14CF-167
Conditions apply to prison and probation
Restitution
CC and DOC fees
2.5 % of any prison wages
AODA and comply unless done in prison
No alcohol or drugs w/o Rx from a Dr.
Random testing
No contact with any known drug users or dealers
Any other conditions up to PO
No jail credit

Appeal rights advised

As to 13CF-411 the ftp commitment is quashed and the fine be part of probation/extended supervision
